metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9213 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel before 4.20.14, expand_downwards in mm/mmap.c lacks a check for the mmap minimum address, which makes it easier for attackers to exploit kernel NULL pointer dereferences on non-SMAP platforms. This is related to a capability check for the wrong task. Jann Horn discovered that the mmap implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly check for the mmap minimum address in some situations. A local attacker could use this to assist exploiting a kernel NULL pointer dereference vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
